etymology.description: 工程 (engineering; project) + 师 (master; specialist) = engineer.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the field ‘engineering/project’ with the professional suffix 师 to indicate a trained specialist in engineering. Follows the productive pattern of profession nouns like 医师 and 会计师.
etymology.simplification: Only 師 → 师 was simplified in the PRC to reduce strokes and regularize the component shape; 工程 is unchanged.

examples.chinese: 她是土木工程师(她是土木工程師)，负责设计桥梁(負責設計橋梁)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì tǔmù gōngchéngshī, fùzé shèjì qiáoliáng.
examples.english: She is a civil engineer and is responsible for designing bridges.

examples.chinese: 他是软件工程师(他是軟件工程師)，编写高性能程序(編寫高性能程序)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì ruǎnjiàn gōngchéngshī, biānxiě gāo xìngnéng chéngxù.
examples.english: He is a software engineer who writes high‑performance programs.

examples.chinese: 在公司里(在公司裡)，工程师们与团队合作(工程師們與團隊合作)，解决复杂的技术问题(解決複雜的技術問題)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gōngsī lǐ, gōngchéngshīmen yǔ tuánduì hézuò, jiějué fùzá de jìshù wèntí.
examples.english: At the company, engineers work with the team to solve complex technical problems.
